name: Mercury
description: Mercury (0.4 AU from the Sun) is the closest planet to the Sun and on average, all seven other planets.

name: Venus
description: Venus (0.7 AU from the Sun) is close in size to Earth (0.815 M⊕) and, like Earth, has a thick silicate mantle around an iron core, a substantial atmosphere, and evidence of internal geological activity.

name: Earth
description: Earth (1 AU from the Sun) is the largest and densest of the inner planets, the only one known to have current geological activity, and the only place where life is known to exist.

name: Mars
description: Mars (1.5 AU from the Sun) is smaller than Earth and Venus (0.107 M⊕)

name: Jupiter
description: Jupiter (5.2 AU), at 318 M⊕, is 2.5 times the mass of all the other planets put together.

name: Saturn
description: Saturn (9.5 AU), distinguished by its extensive ring system, has several similarities to Jupiter, such as its atmospheric composition and magnetosphere.

name: Uranus
description: Uranus (19.2 AU), at 14 M⊕, is the lightest of the outer planets.

name: Neptune
description: Neptune (30.1 AU), though slightly smaller than Uranus, is more massive (17 M⊕) and hence more dense.

name: Pluto
description: The dwarf planet Pluto (39 AU average) is the largest known object in the Kuiper belt.

name: Makemake
description: Makemake (45.79 AU average), although smaller than Pluto, is the largest known object in the classical Kuiper belt (that is, a Kuiper belt object not in a confirmed resonance with Neptune).

name: Haumea
description: Haumea (43.13 AU average) is in an orbit similar to Makemake, except that it is in a temporary 7:12 orbital resonance with Neptune.
